Detailed Area¶

The detail area displays the details of the last task you selected in the table.

Select a task in the table by clicking in the row where the task appears or by clicking in the selection column. The detail area (position depends on the setting selected) is populated with units of information about the selected task.

The following units of information can be found for all or almost all task types:

Context¶

The Context unit of information contains the parent hierarchy of the task. The task itself appears at the end of the hierarchy chain.

This representation allows you to:

  • Understand the importance of the task more quickly
  • Navigate from the uppermost hierarchy level to the parent context object (e.g. project, workflow, etc.) with just one click

Note

The first identifiable context will be displayed even if there are other potential paths. If you require a different context hierarchy for a specific example, please contact your administrator.

Description¶

The Description unit of information generally contains a detailed description of the task, including relevant metadata or interaction options. The interaction options are also determined by the task type. For example, for projects the interaction options might include the duration of the project, the effort and the progress to date.

Linked objects¶

Note

Linked objects (e.g. checklists, checklist items) are not defined for every task. Linked objects will only be displayed if they have been configured for the specific task type.

Between the Description and Activities units of information any number of blocks of linked objects may appear. The name of the relationship (e.g. checklist items or checklist) becomes the title of the block. Each block displays the first three elements. Click on More… to display all of the elements.

It is usually possible to click on the linked objects directly from the detail area of CONTACT Tasks to view the data sheet. If this is not possible, please contact your administrator.

Activities¶

In the Activities unit of information, you can create postings or comment on postings created by your colleagues. You can enter a new posting about the task in the top input field or comment on a posting created by a colleague in the response field.

Depending on the task type, the activities correspond to different hierarchy levels specified by the administrator. It is then possible to determine the relationship between the activity and the task itself, the parent workflow or the parent project.

Further details on Activities can be found in the Activities user manual.
